# KeyJawn

> Custom Android keyboard for terminal and LLM CLI usage

KeyJawn is a mobile keyboard that adds terminal keys (Esc, Tab, Ctrl, arrow keys), voice input, SCP image upload, and slash command shortcuts to a standard QWERTY layout. Built for people who SSH into servers from their phones to use AI CLI tools like Claude Code and OpenClaw.

## Versions

- KeyJawn Full ($4 lifetime): Terminal keys, voice input, SCP upload, clipboard history, slash commands, swipe gestures, per-app autocorrect toggle. No subscriptions, no ads, no tracking.
- KeyJawn Lite (free): Terminal keys, voice input, number row, alt character popups. No network permissions required.

## Key features

- Dedicated terminal key row: Esc, Tab, Ctrl (three-state toggle), arrow keys
- Voice-to-text with streaming transcription
- SCP image upload: pick a photo, upload to server, path typed at cursor
- Slash command quick-insert for LLM CLI tools
- Number row with long-press shifted symbols
- Long-press alt characters (accented letters, punctuation variants)
- Clipboard history (last 10 items)
- Per-app autocorrect toggle (off by default for terminals)
- Swipe gestures: left=delete word, right=space, up=symbols, down=letters

## Requirements

- Android 8.0+ (API 26)
- Sideload via APK (not on Play Store)
